title: What Is IEEPA, the Law Trump Used to Impose Tariffs?
summary: A federal appeals court struck down tariffs that President Trump had imposed by invoking a decades-old law.

title: Trump Administration Weighs Having Military Lawyers Work as Immigration Judges
summary: No final decision has been made, but the proposal comes as President Trump increasingly uses the military in various aspects of domestic life.

title: Transportation Dept. Cancels $679 Million for Offshore Wind Projects
summary: The Trump administration’s campaign against wind power continued as it targeted funding for marine terminals and ports to support development of the industry.

title: Trump Administration Bars Palestinian Officials From U.N. Meeting in New York
summary: The United States generally allows foreign officials to attend the United Nations General Assembly. The administration’s move comes amid a new push for Palestinian statehood.

title: What to Know About Secret Service Protection for Former Vice Presidents
summary: The Secret Service usually protects a former vice president for six months after they leave office.

title: Will the C.D.C. Survive?
summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s assault may have dealt lasting damage to the agency, experts fear, with harsh consequences for public health.

title: How the Trump-Kennedy Alliance Is Pushing the Boundaries of Public Health
summary: The mutually beneficial relationship between President Trump and Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is based on a striking alignment of some of their views.

title: What to Know About Jim O’Neill, the New Acting C.D.C. Director
summary: The selection of Jim O’Neill, a former Silicon Valley executive, drew objections from Democrats, who noted his lack of medical or scientific training.

title: Missouri Unveils Redistricting Plan, Aiming to Add a Republican Seat
summary: Following Texas, Gov. Mike Kehoe called a special legislative session to redraw his state’s Congressional district lines to boost Republicans.

title: Iowa’s Joni Ernst Will Not Seek Re-election, Putting a Competitive Senate Seat in Play
summary: Democrats still face an uphill fight to win in Iowa and retake the majority in the closely divided Senate.

title: Gov. Greg Abbott Signs Controversial Redistricting Bill, Redrawing Congressional Map
summary: After a bruising redistricting fight, Gov. Greg Abbott signed a new congressional map into law. But the Republican-led Legislature, newly emboldened, has not stopped there.

title: The Overlooked Element to the ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Phenomenon
summary: Beyond its catchy songs and memorable characters, the Netflix movie does an admirable job of capturing what it’s like to be an adoring fan.

title: Families of Minneapolis Church Shooting Victims Pay Loving Tributes
summary: The impact of the deaths of Fletcher Merkel, 8, and Harper Moyski, 10, and the injuries sustained by 18 others are only beginning to be felt.

title: Conservatives Use Minneapolis Shooting in Anti-Transgender Campaigns
summary: Activists are pointing to the attacker’s gender identity to falsely portray all transgender people as prone to mental illness and violence.

title: ‘The Queen of Versailles’ Puts Her Life in the Hands of a ‘Wicked’ Diva
summary: A 2012 documentary asked if Jacqueline Siegel was a benefactor or victim of American greed. A new musical starring Kristin Chenoweth raises doubts.

title: Riding Amtrak’s New Acela Train: Sleeker, Comfier and a Tiny Bit Faster
summary: The NextGen high-speed trains feel more like those in China, Japan or France. But topping out at 160 m.p.h., they’re still relatively slow.

title: Strangers Come Together to Deliver Baby Girl at Burning Man Festival
summary: A woman unexpectedly went into labor at the desert festival. Within minutes, a neonatal nurse, an OB-GYN, a pediatric doctor and other attendees filled her camper.

title: Can This Chef Revive Babbo, Mario Batali’s Signature Restaurant?
summary: Mark Ladner, a master of Italian cooking and a Batali protégé, is reinventing the Manhattan restaurant under the same famous (and infamous) name.

title: Why the Texas Democrats’ Walkout Worked
summary: Losing loudly has been a crucial feature of successful political movements.

title: Los Angeles Wildfires Left the City With a Toxic Mess
summary: Urban wildfires are becoming public health emergencies.

title: Appeals Court: Many Trump Tariffs Are Illegal
summary: Also, Hurricane Katrina’s legacy. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.

title: At Least 70 Drown Off Mauritania After Boat Capsizes
summary: Around 150 people boarded a boat in Gambia that was thought to have been headed for Europe. The boat capsized after traveling about 380 miles.

title: 3 Workers at Rikers Are Suspended After Another Man Dies in Custody
summary: The death of the 29-year-old, who was found in his cell after midnight, is the latest of several at the Rikers Island jail complex in New York.

title: Looted by Nazis, a 17th-Century Painting Resurfaces. But Not for Long.
summary: The artwork had been missing for 80 years before Dutch journalists spotted it in a real estate listing in Argentina.

title: Alabama Man Once Barred From Office Is Elected Mayor
summary: Patrick Braxton won the first mayoral election in a half century in the small town of Newbern, five years after its leaders put up roadblocks to his assuming office.
